project_abstract.cdata: The goal of the Private and Public Sector Institution Building Loan Project (PPIBL) is to provide the required techncial assistance to implement the policy measures which will be supported by the Second Private Sector Adjustment Loan Project (PSAL II) (report no. P7507), and to lay the ground for the reforms that will be implemented under the proposed Programmatic Adjustment Loan (PAL). The project has five project components. The first, the Financial Sector Restructuring and Privatization Support component, provides technical assistance to restructure CEC (savings Bank) in preparation for privatization; develops capital markets by strengthening legislation, regulatory capacity and infrastructure; strenthens the capital markts regulatory agencies; and strengthens insurance supervision. The second component supports privatization of the ten largest state enterprises. The third component provides technical assistance for the divestiture of key enterprises in the oil, gas, and electricity/power sectors, including majority or strategic sales under market conditions. The fourth component supports an improved business environment and covers training of judges and court personnel, procurement of court equipment, refurbishing works, and a public awareness campaign. The fifth component strengthens institutional and governance reform.
